channel.title: Brett-Whitehead family history
channel.description: Recent content on Brett-Whitehead family history

item.title: About
item.description: This is a history website for the family of John Brett and Margaret Joy Whitehead.

item.title: Braginton family history
item.description: See this page on Braginton family history: George Braginton, the oldest son of Richard Braginton, was baptised on 28 Feb 1808 in Ottery St Mary, Devon. On 13 Jan 1835, at St Giles in the Wood, he married Margaret Grace Vicary, the widow of William Cotton. Margaret Grace Vicary, the daughter of Thomas Cornish Vicary and Margaret Fry, was baptised at Great Torrington, Devon on 6 Dec 1807. Her marriage to William Cotton produced two children.

item.title: Brett - Howcroft
item.description: There is a Mary Ann Brett at this MyHeritage.com page that appears to match John Brett’s partner and Michael’s mother. FeeBMD has no record of a marriage between “John Brett” and someone with surname “Howcroft” between 1840 and 1902. Christiana Payne’s biography notes that “as far as anyone has been able to ascertain, John Brett and Mary Ann Howcroft […] were never actually married.” The record for John Brett’s household in the 1881 census records these household members at No 6 Keswick Road, London:

item.title: Brett - Lee
item.description: Data for the family of Michael Brett and Nellie Mary Lee. Their marriage is probably (FreeBMD): Marriages Mar 1902 Brett Michael Wandsworth 1d 929 Michael’s census record for 1911 shows him to be living in Hangerlea, Stansted Road, Bishop’s Stortford, with this household: Name Age Michael Brett 39 Nellie Mary Brett 29 Joan Brett 8 John Brett 6 Peter Brett 1 Tirzah Faulder 25 Caroline Alice Hudgell 24 Annie Amelia Smith 27 Children Joan Brett John Brett.

item.title: Brett - Pilbean
item.description: These are notes for the family of Charles Curtis Brett and Ann Pilbean. See Charles Curtis Brett’s wikitree entry. This says that he married Ann “Pilbin” on 12 June 1823. The Dictionary of National Biography has this as “Pilbean”, and Ann’s birth year as 1808/9 - see page on John Brett (painter). Charles Curtis Brett’s household in the 1851 census: Name Age Relation Profession Charles C Brett 67 Head Vetinary surgeon ?

item.title: Brett - Whitehead
item.description: Note for the family of John Brett (b 1905) and (Margaret) Joy Whitehead. From the https://www.freebmd.org.uk entry below, they married in 1928. Type: Marriages Surname: Brett First name(s): John Start date: Mar 1920 End date: Dec 1935 Spouse/Mother's surname: Whitehead Spouse's first name(s): Margaret Marriages Jun 1928 Brett John Whitehead Lewisham 1d 2117 John and Joy had three children: Sue Oliver Jenifer Brooke-Smith Martin Brett b 1939-01-06.

item.title: Burke's Peerage on Whitehead family
item.description: See this Whitehead extract from Burke’s peerage, 1949 for a full summary of the Whitehead family tree to 1949. Quoting from that extract: Gilbert Hinds, b. 26 May, 1866 ; to. 10 April, 1901, •Helena Emmeline, (New Raven, Eltham, Kent), only dau. of late Henry A. Langford, of Plymouth, and d. 18 Dec. 1908, leaving issue, Margaret Joy, m. 5 May, 1928, Lt.-Cmdr. John Brett, D.S.C., R.N., elder son of Michael Brett, of Bishop’s Stortford, and has issue.

item.title: Charles Curtis Brett
item.description: See Charles Curtis Brett’s wikitree entry. Grandfather: Curtis Brett (b ~1720), printer. CB wikitree entry. CB will. His children were Charles Richard Brett (born and died 1761) and Curtis Brett (b 1765) Father: Curtis Brett (b 1765). CB Jr wikitree entry. Charles Curtis married Ann Pilbean in 1823.

item.title: Clara Louisa Braginton
item.description: See this page on Braginton family history. From that page: Clara Louisa’s father was a shipowner, and probably named one of his ships “Clara Louisa” after his daughter. Siblings: Margaret Ann (1835), Clara Louisa (1837), George Vicary (1840), Georgina Merrill (1843), Alice Jane (1845) and Richard George (1849) Clara Louisa’s birth record may well be: Births Dec 1837 (>99%) BRAGINTON Louisa Launceston 9 125 Edmund Allen Johns married Clara Braginton in 1857:

item.title: Gilbert Hinds Whitehead
item.description: According to a Peerage.com page on Sir James Whitehead, Gilbert Hinds Whitehead was the fifth child (and third son) of Sir James Whitehead, 1st Baronet and Mercy Matilda Hinds. He married Helena Emmeline Langford. Death record (FreeBMD): Deaths Dec 1949 (>99%) Whitehead Helena E 77 Woolwich 5d 878 See also Whitehead family grave.

item.title: Helena Emmeline Langford
item.description: Martin Brett tells me that “Granny Whitehead” preferred “Emmeline”. Emmeline’s parents were Henry Albert Langford and Clara Louisa Braginton. Emmeline married Gilbert Hinds Whitehead. Death record (FreeBMD): Deaths Dec 1949 (>99%) Whitehead Helena E 77 Woolwich 5d 878 See also Whitehead family grave and Whitehead extract from Burke’s peerage. In the 1881 census, Helena Emmilina Langford was at 5 North Hills Terrace, in the following household: Name Age Relation Marriage Profession Clara Louisa Langford 42 Head Widow Lady Ellen Macornick Johns 22 Daughter Single Lady Richard Braginton Johns 18 Son Single Solicitor’s articled clerk Helena Emmilina Langford 8 Daughter Single Scholar George Stawell Tuckey 27 Visitor Single Solicitor Fanny Gent 47 Servant Single Cook Domestic Elizabeth Dunn 16 Servant Single Housemaid See the HEL 1881 census original image

item.title: John Brett (b 1831)
item.description: See John Brett’s wikipedia entry The Dictionary of National Biography (1912) on John Brett (the painter). “BRETT, JOHN (1831–1902), landscape painter, born at Bletchingley, Surrey, on 8 Dec. 1831, was eldest son of Captain Charles Curtis Brett of the 12th lancers by his wife Ann Philbrick. […] He died in his house at Putney on 8 Jan. 1902. He married in 1870, and had four sons and three daughters who survived him.

item.title: John Brett (b 1905)
item.description: John died in World War 2, when his ship HMS Gloucester sank, on May 22nd 1941. He was born on 27 March 1905 (see Peerage.com article). He married Margaret Joy Whitehead on 5 May 1928. John was the son of Michael Brett, who was the eldest son of John Brett, the painter. He was commissioned into the Royal Navy on 15 September 1918, and gained these ranks: Midshipman: 15 January 1923 Sub-Lieutenant: 15 November 1925 Lieutenant: 15 November 1927 Lieutenant-Commander: 15 November 1935.

item.title: John Brett: Pre-Raphaelite Landcape Painter
item.description: A biography of John Brett: John Brett Pre-Raphaelite Landscape Painter Christiana Payne September 21, 2010, Yale University Press 304 pages, 9.5 x 11 ISBN: 9780300165753 See the Yale University Press page.

item.title: Langford - Braginton
item.description: Henry A Langford married Clara Louisa Johns (née Braginton) in 1866, in Plymouth: Marriages Jun 1866 LANGFORD Henry A Plymouth 5b 437 This Burke’s peerage entry states that Helena Emmeline Langford was the daughter of Henry A. Langford. Apart from Helena Emmeline, there was only one other Langford born in Plymouth between 1864 and 1890: Births Jun 1868 (>99%) LANGFORD Albert Leonard Plymouth 5b 265 Albert Leonard Langford died at age 11, also in Plymouth, which would explain why he is not in Clara Louisa’s Household in 1881.

item.title: Margaret Joy Whitehead
item.description: Margaret Joy went by “Joy”. Her parents were Gilbert Hinds Whitehead and Helena Emmeline Whitehead. Margaret Joy was born on 5 May 1928 (see Whitehead extract from Burke’s peerage). She married John Brett in 1928. John died in 1941. Joy married to Robert Clement Giles in 1965 (see Burke’s reference above). She died in 1981 https://www.freebmd.org.uk: Deaths Jun 1981 (>99%) GILES MARGARET JOY 12JE1905 SURREY S W 17 1323

item.title: Michael Brett
item.description: From Christiana Payne’s biography of John brett p 109, Michael born on July 1871. See Michael’s Wikisource data. This suggests is birth record is (FreeBMD): Births Dec 1872 BRETT Michael Dorking 2a 137 Michael Brett married Nellie Mary Lee.

item.title: MyHeritage entry for Mary Ann Howcroft
item.description: There is a Mary Ann Brett at this MyHeritage.com page that appears to match John Brett’s partner and Michael’s mother. Mary Ann Brett, Brett (born Howcroft) was born on month day 1843, at birth place, to William HOWCROFT and Mary Anne HOWCROFT (born HALL). William was born in 1791, in Yorkshire, England. Mary was born on April 21 1815, in Worthing, Sussex, England. Mary was baptized on month day 1844, at baptism place.

item.title: Whitehead - Langford
item.description: About the family of Gilbert Hinds Whitehead and Helena Emmeline Langford. See Whitehead extract from Burke’s peerage for full summary of Whitehead family tree to 1949. From that source, the couple: Married on 10 April 1901; had one child Margaret Joy, on 5 May 1928. Marriage record is very likely to be: Marriages Jun 1901 (>99%) Whitehead Gilbert Hinds Truro 5c 237

item.title: Whitehead family grave
item.description: This site about a gravesite for the Whitehead family has the following information: Gilbert Hinds Whitehead Third son of Sir James Whitehead. Bart. Born 26th May 1886, died 18th December 1908 Helena Emmeline, wife of the above Born 10 May 1872, died 18 Oct 1949

Reverend Samuel Henry Farwell Roe Births Sep 1856 (>99%) Roe Samuel Henry Farwell Camelford 5c 10 Deaths Mar 1943 (>99%) ROE Samuel H F 86 Barnstaple 5b 567 A grave from Marlborough Road Cemetery, Ilfracombe, Devon: https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/124810872/farwell-roe """ Sacred to the memory of Revd Farwell Roe died 19th March 1943 Also of Jane Roe, his wife, died 23rd February 1948." """ Deaths Mar 1948 (>99%) Roe Jane 69 Barnstaple 7a 293

item.title: Talking to Marting Brett
item.description: Conversation between Matthew and Martin Brett, 10 May 2020 Helena Emmeline preferred “Emmeline”. Emmeline lived with “Aunt Alice” and an unfriendly vicar in Zennor, in Cornwall. She (Granny Whitehead) would do an impression of the thick accent of the postman. A distant relative, surname Johns, gave a significant amount of money to Emmeline in his will, enough to buy a car.
